Hello Romain,

I'm not sure I understand why you have to sleep. If your precedence
calculating thing (which I guess runs outside heritrix?) only responds
when it has the answer then you wouldn't need any messy sleeping. But
in any case sleeping only affects one ToeThread. Processing of other
urls continues in parallel. It sounds like you want processing of that
same url to continue in parallel, but that's not how heritrix works.
Each processor runs in sequence. The one thing you can do to get more
than one url from the same host to be processed in parallel, is set
the value of parallelQueues on your queueAssignmentPolicy to something
greater than 1. You should be conservative with that setting though
because it lets heritrix violate its usual politeness rules.

Noah

On Wed, Sep 18, 2013 at 1:56 AM, Romain Noel <tereo27@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hello,
>
> I want to assign a precedence score for each URI according to information of
> its parent.
> The WARC of the parent need to be process and so it takes few seconds to
> extract the needed information. That's why heritrix has to wait before
> adding the candidate URI to the frontier.
>
> I try a Thread.sleep() into my precedence method but all heritrix stops.
> In fact i just want to subscribe my method to an event, or to wait x
> seconds, before adding my new candidate to the frontier but meanwhile, i
> want that heritrix keep crawling enqueued URI.
> Where and how can I do that ?
> Maybe, it should be better to add all candidate URI without precedence, and
> to re-order the candidate list into the frontier ? (where exactly ?)
>
> Thank's a lot
>
> Romain
> -- -- --
>
>
>
>
